Description: Fragment of rim and neck of Chian pottery transport amphora; torus lip. White slip with red painted decoration on lip and around handle root, with vertical just to its left. White inclusions in the clay.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 39, no. 144, pl. 34)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JA.027)
